alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 8:17AM CDT until July 10 at 10:37PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Blaine, Custer, Caddo and Canadian Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding affects croplands... pastures... and oil wells near the river. Middle and upper bottomlands may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. Sand dredging operations are affected. Upstream points in southern Blaine County experience flooding before the areas near Bridgeport in northern Caddo County. Downstream points in southwestern Canadian County are affected hours later. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data and the river stage at 7:00 AM CDT was estimated at 12.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this afternoon to 14.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon to 13.1 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will rise to 13.3 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM CDT.
